text: he was a singer songwriter and performer
whose work influenced generations of
musicians Lou Reed initially found fame
when he formed the Velvet Underground in
the 1960s the group's combination of
emotionally powerful music and complex
yet accessible lyrics didn't produce
much in the way of commercial success
but in musical terms it was
groundbreaking
credited with being instrumental in the
development of punk and the alternative
rock scene of the 1970s
he and the band also came to the
attention of Andy Warhol who helped
produce their first album and throughout
his career Murray paid tribute to
Warhol's contribution you know
everything I do is from the outside and
have had hadn't been for Andy who knows
whether would have had a chance to do
anything so I think I I owe everything
to mr. Warhol thanks
Paulo came from Miami FL
after the Velvet Underground went their
separate ways Lou Reed embarked on a
solo career his 1972 album transformer
produced by huge admirer and David Bowie
included his top 20 u.s. hit walk on the
wild side take a walk on the wild side
take a walk on the world its
controversial subjects matter bought
read a new way for fans and although his
subsequent albums were often far more
experimental one was an hour of
electronic feedback he always said the
most important thing was to try and move
people for me any good song stimulates
some kind of emotion I mean what other
thing is there that makes people get up
